executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on international stocks, particularly China Tech, and sees a buying opportunity in high-quality companies affected by tariff fears. He believes the market has priced in the worst-case scenario and that any short-term pain will lead to long-term gains. He is particularly excited about opportunities in the home building sector and related industries as mortgage rates decline. He emphasizes the importance of being a selective buyer during times of crisis and dislocation, focusing on companies with strong moats and durable businesses.

tom_current_conviction.overall_market: Bullish, especially on international and value stocks.
key_reasons: Market has priced in the worst-case tariff scenario.
International stocks are poised to outperform US stocks.
Value stocks are outperforming growth stocks.

macro_thesis_summary: The market is experiencing a clearing event related to tariff uncertainty, which creates opportunities to buy high-quality companies at discounted prices. International markets, particularly China, are poised to outperform the US due to stimulus and a weaker dollar. The housing sector is set to benefit from declining mortgage rates and demographic trends.
